ciscoMabMIB.name: ciscoMabMIB

revisions.description: Initial version of this MIB module.

ciscoMabMIB.contactinfo: Cisco Systems Customer Service Postal: 170 W Tasman Drive San Jose, CA 95134 USA Tel: +1 800 553 -NETS E-mail: cs-ibns@cisco.com, cs-lan-switch-snmp@cisco.com
ciscoMabMIB.description: MIB module for monitoring and configuring MAC Authentication Bypass (MAB) feature in the system. MAC Auth Bypass feature provides controlled access to devices based on their MAC addresses. MAB allows non-dot1x compliant end devices controlled access to network and also provides a replacement technology for VLAN Management Policy Server (VMPS) environments. MAB is also an intergal part of the Network Access Control (NAC) program which enables network access for the clients and subsequently carry out a posture assessment of these clients. MAC Authentication Bypass feature provides a mechanism that uses the MAC address of the connecting device to grant or deny network access for it.

cmabIfConfigTable.name: cmabIfConfigTable
cmabIfConfigTable.description: A list of interfaces which supports MAC Authentication Bypass.

cmabIfConfigEntry.name: cmabIfConfigEntry
cmabIfConfigEntry.description: Entry containing Mac Authentication Bypass configuration for a particular interface.

cmabIfAuthEnabled.name: cmabIfAuthEnabled
cmabIfAuthEnabled.description: Specifies if MAC Authentication Bypass feature is enabled on the interface.

cmabIfAuthMethod.name: cmabIfAuthMethod
cmabIfAuthMethod.description: Specifies the authentication method used by MAC Authentication Bypass. radius(1) : communication with authentication server is performed via RADIUS messages. eap(2) : communication with authentication server is performed via EAP messages.

cmabClientInfoTable.name: cmabClientInfoTable
cmabClientInfoTable.description: A list of active MAC Authentication Bypass clients in the system. An entry exists for each MAC Authentication Bypass session in the system. An entry is deleted if the MAC Authentication Bypass session is removed from the system.

cmabClientInfoEntry.name: cmabClientInfoEntry
cmabClientInfoEntry.description: Entry containing management information of MAC Authentication Bypass for a particular session.

cmabClientSessionId.name: cmabClientSessionId
cmabClientSessionId.description: A unique identifier of the MAC Authentication Bypass session.

cmabClientMacAddress.name: cmabClientMacAddress
cmabClientMacAddress.description: The MAC address of the MAB client.

cmabClientMabState.name: cmabClientMabState
cmabClientMabState.description: Indicates the session state of the MAB state machine for the MAB client. other : None of the below. initialize : Initializing the authentication session. acquiring : Acquiring client's MAC address for the authentication process. authorizing: Authorization is in progress. terminate : Authorization is completed.

cmabClientAuthStatus.name: cmabClientAuthStatus
cmabClientAuthStatus.description: This object indicates whether the MAB client is authorized. authorized : the session is authorized. unauthorized: the session is not authorized.

cmabCompliance.name: cmabCompliance
cmabCompliance.description: The compliance statement for entities which implement CISCO-MAB-MIB.

cmabIfConfigGroup.name: cmabIfConfigGroup
cmabIfConfigGroup.description: A collection of objects that provides per interface configuration of MAC Authentication Bypass feature.

cmabClientInfoGroup.name: cmabClientInfoGroup
cmabClientInfoGroup.description: A collection of objects that provides information of MAC Authentication Bypass sessions in the devices.
